The Rams swept the Lobos in 2012 and could pull into a tie for second place on the Mountain with another sweep of the Lobos., 15752=Most athletes can look back on certain accomplishments in their sport with fondness or a sense of achievement. These Lobos pushed New Mexico softball into the Top 25 in 2012 and have posted dramatic wins over Top 25 teams., 18278=The seniors that came into the program four years ago were recruited to New Mexico by Ty Singleton. They struggled through an 11-37 season in Singleton's final year, a trying trek that saw the 2010 Lobos go 1-14 in the Mountain West., 11676=May 8, 2013, 15093=The Lobos of 2013 haven't exactly punched out a memorable season, but watching all these Lobos on and off the field has made the season special. These Lobos play hard. They play with passion and purpose.}
textBeforeTable: NEW MEXICO LOBOS 2013 SOFTBALL ROSTER Kaela DeBroeck Editor's Note: Richard Stevens is a former award-winning Sports Columnist and Associate Sports Editor at The Albuquerque Tribune. You can reach him at rstevens50@comcast.net. Said Guillermo: "They are all like 19 sisters to me." "These people are always going to be in your life," said Ingram. For sure, there will be some tears shed on Saturday. That's the way it is when you say goodbye to teammates and friends. Senior Kaela DeBroeck, an intensely competitive Lobo, will see a lot of mound time vs. CSU. "It's been a great time, a great journey," DeBroeck said of her four years as a Lobo. New Mexico is looking for a splash of revenge and a hoping to put a feel-good ending on the 2013 season.
